07. Release Notes - BAE Version 4.6 Release BAE-SQ-M-20190719

    • Cover Page






    • 1. Release Components


      This release consists of following components.

      • Design Framework (Universal Template) v3.4
      • Super Merge Template v3.4
      • Process Management Template v3.4
      • Boardwalk Core Engine with ReST APIs v2.1
      • Boardwalk Client Virtual Machine v2.1





    • 2. Universal Template Supported Versions






    • 3. Release Highlight


      This release is focused on security. BAE server is now verified by Veracode, which is one of the leading platforms in the domain of application security. Please refer to Appendix A for Veracode static scan report.





      • 4. Enhancements


        Below is the list of major enhancements in this release.





      • 4.1 Security Features:


        • Encrypted Database Credentials in WEB.XML
        Now BAE Administrator can set up the server with encrypted Database credentials in WEB.XML file.

        • Support for ‘HttpOnly’ functionality
        HttpOnly functionality configuration is added in WEB.XML to prevent Cross-Site Scripting issues.

        • Password History Policy
        Password History Policy can be configured so that the password cannot be changed to last n number of passwords where n can be configured using Process Management Template.





      • 4.2 Design Framework Enhancements:


        • ID Independent Universal Template
        The new Universal Template works with Cuboid Hierarchy (Neighborhood Name/Collaboration Name/Whiteboard Name/Cuboid Name) instead of Cuboid Ids. This will remove dependency on IDs and reduce migration efforts from one environment to other environments.
        This will also enable leveraging an already designed template by dynamically creating Cuboids with pre-defined structure.

        • Database Mail Functionality from Universal Template
        Database Mail Functionality can be triggered from the Universal Template to send an email.
        Name of the Macro: DataBaseMail in the Module DB Mail.

        • Rename Cuboid Column from Universal Template
        Cuboid Column Names can be renamed from Universal Template directly.

        • Web Grid Interface Configuration from Universal Template
        The process to create Configuration Cuboids for Web Grid Interface can be called directly from Universal Template.

        • Changed Table History to Ledger History
        Table history feature is renamed to Ledger History. However, the underlying functionality remains same.





      • 4.3 Integration Framework Enhancements:


        • Double Byte Character Support for Super Merge
        The Super Merge Stored Procedures now support the Double Byte Characters.

        • Utility Stored Procedures to Delete/Rename a Measure
        Two new Utility Stored Procedures are added to
        Delete a Measure: BW_UTILITY_MEASURE_DELETE
        Rename a Measure: BW_UTILITY_MEASURE_RENAME

        • Utility Stored Procedure to Clone an existing Cuboid Structure
        Name: BW_UTILITY_CLONE_CUBOID_STRUCTURE





      • 4.4 Miscellaneous Changes:


        • Microsoft JDBC Driver for SQL Server
        Server code is updated to use Microsoft JDBC Driver for SQL Server instead of the old JTDS drivers.

        • Admin User Privileges
        Boardwalk User can be configured for Admin privileges so that the user account will be exempted from Password Expiration or Account Locking. This configuration is in ‘BW_USER’ Table with Column Name as ‘IS_ADMIN’.

        • Default Password Length
        Minimum length of password is set to 8. That means by default less than 8 characters password will not be accepted.

        • Tomcat Logging per Webapp
        A new log file will be created prefixed with the application name which will log the information of that Webapp.

        • Double Byte Support for Super Merge
        Super Merge will support the Double Byte Characters.








    • 5. Bug Fixes


      All the Critical and High priority bugs fixed are mentioned below









    • 6. Known Issues and Limitations


      • 14287 - Old Sheet Check is not working with Submit (ReST API)
      • 14301, 14303 – Refresh API call will result into no data when Row Access Criteria or Column Access Criteria is modified (ReST APIs)
      • 14306 - When the Column Access Criteria is set from the UT, it is not returning the correct Cell Access Flag for REST API. As a work around, the Column Access Criteria should be set from browser as well as from UT (ReST APIs)
      • For now, we are providing the Success and Failure operations through the response body, given HTTP Status Code as 200. But we have 1 API call for Delete Collaboration that complies with the HTTP Protocol Standards and returns appropriate error code. Next release of REST API will ensure that all API calls adhere to HTTP standards (ReST APIs)
      • When we are passing invalid transaction Id then server returns gridInfo Object instead of Error (ReST APIs)
      • Multiple Cuboid to Cuboid Supermerge does not support Update Flag
      • Table History does not work for Dynamically Downloaded Cuboid
      • Pipe Symbol (|) is not allowed in the Column names
      • Submit does not support with zero number of rows




    • 7. Appendix A :


      Static Scan Report of Veracode:





      • 8. Appendix B:


        Below is the list of issues which are marked in Veracode as mitigated by design or mitigated by network:





      • 8.1 SQL Injection




        This functionality is being used to call custom stored procedures from the Boardwalk excel client. The custom stored procedures are required to be registered on server before that can be called. The registered stored procedures are stored in a SQL file along with sample signature. While the real call servlet verifies the call along with parameters passed. This approach mitigates the risk of SQL Injection.



      • 8.2 Cross-Site Scripting




        This servlet is invoked by Excel and data is passed in a custom protocol which will break the VBA parsing code if the string is escaped. Hence it must not be handled.



      • 8.3 CRLF Injection





        The CRLF injection issues and Insufficient Input Validation issues flagged for this particular line cannot be fixed using the ESAPI JAR file as ESAPI JAR file itself (the internal jar files used by ESAPI JAR) has errors which prevent it from getting applied. More information on these errors is available at
        https://community.veracode.com/s/question/0D53400004DJusECAT/how-tofix-crlf-http-response-splitting-in-java.

        Instead, as per the https://webspidertech.wordpress.com/2018/07/31/veracode-flaws-crlf-http-response-splitting-cwe-113-java/, it can be understood that replaceAll() call to replace the CRLF instances within the strings will address the potential threat. We have implemented the replaceAll() fix and mitigated issues like these by design.





      • 8.4 Insufficient Input Validation





        The CRLF injection issues and Insufficient Input Validation issues flagged for this particular line cannot be fixed using the ESAPI JAR file as ESAPI JAR file itself (the internal jar files used by ESAPI JAR) has errors which prevent it from getting applied. More information on these errors is available at
        https://community.veracode.com/s/question/0D53400004DJusECAT/how-tofix-crlf-http-response-splitting-in-java

        Instead, as per the https://webspidertech.wordpress.com/2018/07/31/veracode-flaws-crlf-http-response-splitting-cwe-113-java/, it can be understood that replaceAll() call to replace the CRLF instances within the strings will address the potential threat. We have implemented the replaceAll() fix and mitigated issues like these by design.
